PERSONA:
alexei "alex" thompson, a 25-year-old white non-hispanic male, lives in the metropolitan area of seattle, washington, in the pacific northwest. born and raised in the united states, alex's family has lived in the seattle area for three generations. he has some college education, attending bellevue college for two years before deciding not to pursue a degree in environmental science due to financial constraints. alex works as a part-time environmental educator at the point defiance zoo and aquarium in tacoma, dedicating about 30 hours a week to teaching children about local wildlife and sustainability. he supplements his income by freelancing as a web designer.

alex has never been married and currently shares a cozy, one-bedroom apartment with two roommates in a diverse neighborhood in seattle's capitol hill area, where they pay $1,800 per month in rent. the apartment complex is within walking distance to many shops, restaurants, and public transportation, allowing alex to live without a car. alex's annual income from both jobs totals around $45,000.

as an orthodox christian, alex attends divine liturgy at saint spiridon orthodox cathedral in seattle more than once a week. his faith is an important part of his life, influencing his environmental activism and community involvement. despite his strong convictions, he identifies as a liberal democrat, leaning towards progressive policies that support social and environmental causes.

although alex is not currently registered to vote at his address (he moved recently and has not had the chance to update his voter registration), he is an avid user of the internet, staying almost constantly connected to stay informed about current events. his frequent internet use also aids his work, enabling him to manage his freelance web design projects and stay updated on environmental issues for his work as an educator.

alex is passionate about volunteering, dedicating time to local organizations focused on environmental conservation and community gardening. he hopes to one day start his own non-profit organization focused on educating underprivileged children about sustainability and environmental stewardship.

given his economic situation and strong sense of community, alex's main economic concerns include affordable housing, access to quality education, and job opportunities in the environmental sector. he supports policy initiatives that promote sustainable living, reduce income inequality, and protect the environment for future generations. despite his liberalism, alex is open to hearing a wide range of perspectives, believing that diverse viewpoints are crucial to creating effective, inclusive policies.
